q: reading the article, I still do not know, because NEWSWEEK, in my opinion, renders quite an objective review of Donald Rumsfeld 's accomplishments and failings. For example, in the first category-accomplishments: He did succeed in having a major impact on transforming the U.S. military, and even now, some of his 2001 proposals to make the Pentagon more efficient are echoed by Secretary Robert Gates . At DoD, Donald Rumsfeld reorganized the command structure, established training for international peacekeepers, and revitalized Special Operations. As to his failings, Winik lists what we are all familiar with by now: the mangled occupation of Iraq( although Donald Rumsfeld liberally "deleRobert Gates" that responsibility); the fact that he "didn't

In an otherwise charming feature story posted on MLB.com about the charity work that he and his wife do for stray dogs, Mark Buehrle 's comments noticeably changed in tone when Michael Vick 's name came up. Even if you are not a dog lover, how can you sit there and make two dogs fight and one is going to die? said( Mark Buehrle ). "How could you do that if you are somewhat sane? Despite his support for Barack Obama , Colin Powell would make no commitment yet for the 2012 White House race. "I will always vote for the person who I think is best qualified," he said. I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates. I have not yet seen anybody on the Republican side that I am ready to commit to and I am not committed to Barack Obama either. ? Micah Zenko , a political scientist at the Council on Foreign Relations, extensively researched U.S. planning for a military strike on Khurmal in 2002 and detailed it in his book Between Threats and War. He said in an interview that he was unaware that Rumsfeld had advocated bombing the place while Colin Powell was at the U.N. By that time, the Khurmal camp had been largely empty for months, Micah Zenko said.
